Why do we say ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll Dig Our Beer‚Äù? We have 20 taps in our taproom filled with a huge variety of in-house crafted beer and hard seltzer waters, ciders, wine and other drinks. The most common thing our customers tell us is, ‚ÄúYou have something for everyone.‚Äù That‚Äôs because we don‚Äôt have 17 IPA‚Äôs on tap. We usually have 3-5 IPA‚Äôs along with a few sours, belgians, germans, lagers, pilsners, seltzer waters, etc. No matter your taste for beer, we have something you‚Äôll dig. Some RockPit weirdness going on. Is it us or them? | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu Some RockPit weirdness going on. Is it us or them? There‚Äôs some weirdness going on in the RockPit universe. Well‚Ä¶ At least when it comes to some reviews lately. Overwhelmingly, we get positive reviews. Sometimes those positive reviews include constructive criticism like ‚ÄúThe owner Chris needs to wear different deodorant. He smells like a mix of stale beer and animal instinct.‚Äù For the record, I wear Old Spice. And¬†I, of course, made that comment up. Seriously though, most of our reviews are great as evidenced by our overall score after two years. However, we‚Äôve had some weird-ass things said about us lately, and we¬†need your help figuring out if we‚Äôre doing something wrong. Keep in mind that these are four-star reviews. They weren‚Äôt negative reviews. Just weird. Are we just another Hooters/chain restaurant? The review started off as ‚ÄúMuch more of a commercial feeling (like a ‚Äúhometown‚Äù BBQ place that‚Äôs really part of a chain) than the other breweries I‚Äôve been to in the area. Not a bad thing, per se, but‚Ä¶.. Staff is friendly enough but again, less hometown feel, more Hooters like.‚Äù Talk about a weird mix of emotions. On the one hand, I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄúOh hell yes! We made everything by hand in here, so if our work is that good, we kicked ass!‚Äù Hooters spends as much on the interior of their restaurants as we did on our whole brewery. On the other hand, I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄúMy daughter and wife were working that night. What are they wearing when I‚Äôm not around?‚Äù Admittedly I haven‚Äôt been to a Hooters since the mid-2000s. So I‚Äôm not sure if they‚Äôve changed their aesthetic lately. But I don‚Äôt remember them looking like our brewery. So my question to you is: Are we creeping into Hooters/Chain restaurant territory? If so, how? Are we the brewery version of Animal House? The second review ended with ‚ÄúThe decor ‚Äî frat house, 1989‚Ä¶..‚Äù I was never in a fraternity, nor have I ever set foot in one. So I don‚Äôt have much experience in that department. Sean (my business partner) was at Stetson in 1989. Maybe he‚Äôs influencing the updates to the interior as a throwback to his glory days? Either way, the only thing I can think of is we have a historical record of all of our canned beer on display on the steel beams near the entrance. We also have a skateboard given to us by HiFive after they won an award for the design of the ‚ÄúDarth Malt Legs‚Äù can art. (Award-winning Darth Malt Legs design) Other than that, I can‚Äôt think of a reason why he would make that comparison. So‚Ä¶ Any ideas on that comparison? Again, I‚Äôm not complaining as the reviews were good ones. I‚Äôm just worried we‚Äôre not seeing something that others are seeing. Do you see what they‚Äôre saying? If so, shoot me a message at chris@rockpitbrewing.com and let me know. I‚Äôd love to get some good feedback other than changing my deodorant (again). Cheers and see you at RockPit. Introducing Rockpit Brewing | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu Rockpit Brewing is widely considered as the hangout for Orlando locals who love to enjoy a good local craft beer with friends and family. Let us show you why you should join them (including us buying you a beer)‚Ä¶ You‚Äôll enjoy uniquely hand-crafted beer The beer you‚Äôll enjoy at Rockpit Brewing is made from scratch using our unique recipes created right here in our brewery. This beer is waiting for you‚Ä¶ Every beer is hand-crafted by our brewers, Cody and Josh. They spend hours brewing every beer and then spend weeks tediously ensuring the beer is perfect and ready for you to enjoy. We have over 15 ‚Äì 20 of our hand-crafted beers on tap at any given time . So you‚Äôll often be able to come in several times a month and never drink the same beer twice. Unless you turn into one of our regulars and keep¬†returning for your favorite beer. Click here to see our current taplist ‚ÄúIf you like great beer you have to check this place out. Everything they have is nothing short of exceptional and the variety is fantastic because even the pickiest will find something they like.‚Äù ‚Äì Joe Snow, Orlando, FL You‚Äôll easily find the perfect beer for you Let us find the perfect beer for you We make a lot of beer with a ton of variety. Everything from lagers to IPA‚Äôs, blondes to sours and porters to stouts. With the huge variety of beer we create, we know we have something on tap that you‚Äôll absolutely enjoy. But sometimes the hardest part is finding that perfect beer. So we make it easy for you by giving you unlimited samples to ‚Äútry before you buy‚Äù . Just ask for a sample of any beer you want to try and we‚Äôll gladly give you a sample (or 4). To make your experience even better, we never force you to buy more beer than you want. That‚Äôs why we give you the choice to enjoy your beer in 9, 12 or 16 ounce pours .¬†High ABV beers only come in 9 or 12 ounce pours. ‚ÄúGreat new brewery with a good sized selection of beers. We tried four different beers between us and they were all excellent. Friendly staff, quick service, and a great atmosphere. We‚Äôll definitely be visiting again.‚Äù Bobby Harmon, Orlando, FL You‚Äôll Never Go Hungry With Texas-Style BBQ and Delectable Bites Provided By Cecil‚Äôs BBQ Doesn‚Äôt it suck to go to a brewery and have nothing to eat? The perfect pairing‚Ä¶ Cecil‚Äôs BBQ wings with Blackstrap Con Leche We thought so too. That‚Äôs why we worked with our neighbors, Cecil‚Äôs BBQ to¬†create an in-taproom menu for you . This means you order your food here in our taproom, it‚Äôs made next door at Cecil‚Äôs and it‚Äôs delivered right to your table by us . No waiting on Uber eats (although you can certainly order from them as well). With items like Smoked Wings, BBQ Sliders, Fried Pickles and even Grilled Cheese, there is surely something you can find to satisfy your hunger while enjoying your Rockpit Brewing beer . And if you don‚Äôt find something‚Ä¶ you can bring your own food in . Yep, seriously. Bring a publix sub, McDonalds Big Mac or some chik-fil-a nuggets‚Ä¶ we don‚Äôt care. As long as you‚Äôre enjoying yourself at Rockpit, we‚Äôre happy. Click here to see our in-taproom food menu ‚ÄúTheir (Cecil‚Äôs) BBQ is the most delicious in town.‚Äù ‚Äì Delia Rodriquez, Orlando, FL You‚Äôll never be bored with our weekly events like Music Bingo, Trivia and Live Music Better times with beer. Live music every friday night That‚Äôs what you get here. We don‚Äôt want to be just another place selling beer with nothing fun to do. That‚Äôs why we have something going on all the time here at RockPit. Poker, Open Jam Sessions, Music Bingo, Trivia, Live Music, Food Truck parties and pairings are always on our schedule. Coming in soon and want to know what‚Äôs happening? Click here to see our upcoming events ‚Äú Excellent beer lineup and the staff Is very attentive. The experience has been beyond any of my expectations. These people are awesome. You should come here and enjoy a very, very good time. ‚Äú ‚Äì Mario Natera, Orlando, FL Those friends who don‚Äôt drink beer? Yeah, what go them covered This hurts to admit, but not everyone likes beer . If you‚Äôre a craft beer lover and have friends who aren‚Äôt, you know this all too well. We always have something for the non-beer drinkers We‚Äôre doing everything we can to ensure that those who don‚Äôt like beer but enjoy a good wine or cider are well taken care of at Rockpit. We want to help you with those friends who have the ‚ÄúOh, but I won‚Äôt have anything to drink‚Äù complaint . To help you overcome the ‚Äúnothing to drink‚Äù excuse your friends have, we work with a small-batch wine distributor here in the SoDo district to bring you a select wine list that should be satisfying for the wine drinkers in your life. We also stock up on vodka sodas, ciders and other fun drinks for the non-beer drinker. Click here to see our taplist and other drinks We spent a year creating a warm and inviting atmosphere for you to enjoy yourself in ‚ÄúYou can feel the love in this place‚Äù A businessman who‚Äôs about to open a few restaurants in the SoDo area (you‚Äôll know the place soon) told us that recently. We the owners and dozens of our friends and family members worked for a year to build our taproom and brewery. Yes, a year. We built everything by hand so you‚Äôd never be able to find anything like our brewery anywhere in Orlando. Heck, in Florida‚Ä¶ The tables, the bar, the decor, the sign hanging outside‚Ä¶ everything was hand-crafted by us to give you a totally unique, inviting and warm atmosphere to serve as a local gathering place for you, your friends and your family for many years to come. You may have noticed a few ‚Äúmining town‚Äù themed elements in those pictures. Why were those added? Tammy‚Äôs (wife of co-founder Chris) grandfather (Homer Little) was a coal miner in the 1940s and 1950s for the Red Jacket and Island Creek Coal companies. Jeremy‚Äôs mom tells him story after story of the long hours Homer put in just so they could put food in their stomachs and clothes on their backs. He was simply the hardest working man anyone in the family ever knew . To pay homage to the blue-collar work ethic of Homer, we create a coal-country-inspired brewery in his honor. So when you walk into Rockpit, you‚Äôll be reminded that this is a place for hard-working people like you. ‚ÄúRockpit is our new hangout. Amazing beer and staff. The atmosphere is welcoming, spacious, and great for private parties. Cecil‚Äôs bbq is right next door, and there is a menu at Rockpit that you can order from, which Cecil‚Äôs will deliver. Go there hungry and thirsty! We absolutely love this place!‚Äù ‚Äì Scott Thompson, Orlando, FL You can bring the kiddos and the pups along with you Want to know the two most asked questions we‚Äôre asked here at Rockpit? Are you dog friendly? Are you kid friendly? And the answer to both of those questions is‚Ä¶ YES! 1000%! Co-founders Chris & Sean and several of our bartenders have kids ranging from the ages of 1 to 25 (guess that dates a few of us). So it‚Äôs only natural that we are kid friendly. In fact, you‚Äôll probably see our kids in the brewery every once in a while. And being dog parents and dog lovers, we welcome our canine friends at Rockpit. We even have readily available water bowls so you don‚Äôt have to worry about them going thirsty. So bring the kids and canines and enjoy a few beers with them at Rockpit. ‚ÄúLoved the laidback atmosphere and the staff was super friendly. They‚Äôre dog friendly too, so that scored major bonus points with me.‚Äù ‚Äì Jennifer Hershey We‚Äôre easy to get to and have plenty of parking available Our location is behind Cecil‚Äôs BBQ on Orange Ave near the intersection of Michigan and Orange at 10 W Illiana St, Orlando, FL 32806 Click the map below to get directions from Google Maps Although our parking lot in front of the brewery only has around 20 spaces, we have another 30+ spots across the street at the DoSo office suites. Please don‚Äôt park at ABC liquor. You can also park at Cecil‚Äôs BBQ after they close for the night . Which is normally 9 PM every night. The beer is great (have not had a bad one yet). The staff is very friendly and the service is great. Place looks awesome and the food is great. It‚Äôs also family and pet friendly. Look forward to going here every chance I get. ‚Äú ‚Äì Tim Schwartz, Orlando, FL We‚Äôll buy you a beer if you buy the first one Seriously. We want you to swing by and give us a try. If you agree to give us your email address below so we can shoot you a message about how to claim your free beer, we‚Äôll buy you a beer when you buy the first one. We‚Äôre opening our taproom again. | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu We‚Äôre opening our taproom again It‚Äôs been a rough few weeks, but the light at the end of the tunnel is shining through. We‚Äôre opening our doors today (Thursday) at Noon so you can enjoy a beer or a few in the taproom or outside on the patio. And no, this isn‚Äôt a protest or anything like that. We worked out a deal with Gypsy and the Fleur D‚ÄôElise food truck to play within the rules set by the Florida DBPR, which allows us to open back up for onsite consumption. We owe a great deal of gratitude to Gypsy. She came through big time for us, and without her hard work, we‚Äôd be dead in the water still. We‚Äôre still working with Cecil‚Äôs to bring you the best BBQ in Orlando, but we will probably need a few days to get their staff back up and running for us. This shutdown hurt. Bad. RockPit and every other brewery that didn‚Äôt ‚Äúserve food‚Äù was royally screwed by the Florida DBPR. When they allowed restaurants to serve alcohol, that was like a death blow for all of us. (Jax = DBPR, Shang Tsung = Us) But I‚Äôm not going to dwell on it. As Andy and Red say in The Shawshank Redemption: ‚ÄúGet busy living or get busy dying.‚Äù We‚Äôre getting busy living. That said, let‚Äôs cover a few things you need to know about when visiting the taproom. First, based on the Orlando EO, you have to wear a mask when entering RockPit and while ordering your beer from the bar. You‚Äôll want to take it off when enjoying your beer unless you have one of those fancy masks with an opening. (You‚Äôll need to bring your own straw) We‚Äôve removed most of the bar seating and spaced all the tables out at LEAST 6 feet . We have more room inside the taproom now that Orlando Homebrew Supplies moved next door. The expanded taproom space isn‚Äôt finished just yet but will be this weekend. However, there are a few tables in the new area where you can sit. If we do get busy (as we usually do) and all the tables inside are filled, there is plenty of outdoor seating available. If you still prefer not to enjoy onsite consumption, our online sales will continue with curbside pickup available. Call us when you arrive, and we‚Äôll run your order out to you. I gotta run now. I need to get to the brewery and finish that expanded taproom area, but I want to leave you with a quick story. My wife asked me this morning, ‚ÄúAre you excited to see people in the taproom?‚Äù I replied, ‚ÄúHonestly, not really.‚Äù You might be thinking, ‚ÄúWhat the hell, Chris? You‚Äôre not excited to see me in the taproom again?‚Äù Of course, I am. Beyond excited. Like this. But in the back of my mind, all I can think of is getting a visit from some three or four-letter agency who will try their hardest to shut us down again. So it‚Äôs hard to be excited with power-hungry agencies looking to shut us down. And unfortunately, there are those out there who want another complete shutdown of everything, so I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll be riding around town looking for ‚Äúviolators.‚Äù We‚Äôve seen it happen to a few places already. Luckily, the places targeted by the vigilantes had all their ducks in a row. I don‚Äôt want to give anyone the firepower they crave to shut our doors again, so please¬†help us out and play within the rules . Wear the mask, keep your distance, dance when your favorite song comes on. In other words, be cool. We both know you got that covered. Thank you again for your support during this craziness. To say it‚Äôs been stressful, frustrating and mind-boggling is an understatement. But again,¬†like Red said‚Ä¶ Here‚Äôs to getting busy¬†living. ‚Äì Chris Our Location 10 W Illiana St Orlando, FL 32806 (407) 826-1773 beer@rockpitbrewing.com Hours Monday ‚Äì 12PM-10PM Tuesday ‚Äì 12PM-10PM Thursday ‚Äì 12PM-10PM Wednesday ‚Äì 12PM-10PM Friday ‚Äì 12PM-12AM Sunday ‚Äì 12PM-8PM Saturday ‚Äì 12PM-12AM Discover more things to do in Orlando Download The App, Get A Free Drink (and more!) Privacy Policy | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu Welcome to our Privacy Policy Your privacy is critically important to us. RockPit Brewing, LLC is located at: RockPit Brewing, LLC 10 W Illiana St Orlando 32806 ‚Äì Florida , United States 4078261773 It is RockPit Brewing, LLC‚Äôs policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect while operating our website. This Privacy Policy applies to https://rockpitbrewing.com (hereinafter, ‚Äúus‚Äù, ‚Äúwe‚Äù, or ‚Äúhttps://rockpitbrewing.com‚Äù). We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting personally identifiable information you may provide us through the Website. We have adopted this privacy policy (‚ÄúPrivacy Policy‚Äù) to explain what information may be collected on our Website, how we use this information, and under what circumstances we may disclose the information to third parties. This Privacy Policy applies only to information we collect through the Website and does not apply to our collection of information from other sources. This Privacy Policy, together with the Terms and conditions posted on our Website, set forth the general rules and policies governing your use of our Website. Depending on your activities when visiting our Website, you may be required to agree to additional terms and conditions. Website Visitors Like most website operators, RockPit Brewing, LLC collects non-personally-identifying information of the sort that web browsers and servers typically make available, such as the browser type, language preference, referring site, and the date and time of each visitor request. RockPit Brewing, LLC‚Äôs purpose in collecting non-personally identifying information is to better understand how RockPit Brewing, LLC‚Äôs visitors use its website. 2025 Beerlympics by RockPit Brewing and South Orlando Crossfit | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu 2025 Beerlympics by RockPit Brewing and South Orlando Crossfit Think you‚Äôre the best beerlete in Orlando? Wanna prove it? Then come compete in the fifth annual beerlympics here at RockPit Brewing and South Orlando Crossfit . An incredibly fun team event featuring beer-related games that will test your hand-eye coordination, strength, and, of course, beer consumption skills. This is a team event featuring beer-related games that will test your hand-eye coordination, strength, and, of course, beer consumption skills. You can sign up as a single participant but will be assigned a team on the day of the event. We encourage you to get friends to participate with you. Sign Up Now Your team of four will compete in various games. Here are the official 2025 Beerlympics games: 26.2 Meter Obstacle Relay In this game, each team member will run through an obstacle course set up by the CrossFit gym. The team score is based on how long each player takes to navigate the obstacle course successfully. Crazy Straw Chug Relay In this competition, we will fill a cup with your choice of a shot of moonshine or beer for all four team members. One by one, each team member will chug the drink through a crazy straw, run to the next person, and tag them, which will start that team member‚Äôs chug. The game is finished when all four team members have completed the chug and will be scored for total time. Beer-In-Hand Mini Golf For this event, you‚Äôll be required to have a beer in one hand and use the other to putt the golf ball. There are three holes filled with obstacles meant to challenge your one-handed golf skills. But don‚Äôt worry, you have the beer in your hand to help with any frustration that might arise. Team Hammerschlagen Each team member will play Hammerschlagen on a single stump for time in this event. Once the timer starts, each team member must hammer their nail into the wood until it‚Äôs flat with the surface. Your time will stop when the last person has finished hammering their nail. Giant Beer Pong For this game, six garbage cans are arranged in a pyramid, and six beers are placed on a table next to the players. There is one ball that will be used for the game. Each player takes a shot at throwing a ball in the cans. If they make it, they must chug a beer, THEN retrieve their ball and move the trash can out of the way before the next player goes. They must retrieve the ball and toss it to the next player if they miss. The game ends when a ball enters the last trash can, and the contestant chugs their last beer. Double Flip Cup For this game, all four players will chug a beer (or water if they prefer) and flip a cup on the table successfully before the next player takes their turn. After all four players flip their cups, they will move to the other side of the table and flip another cup per team member. The game ends when the contestant successfully flips their last cup. Our Drinks | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu Why do we say ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll Dig Our Drinks‚Äù? We have 20 taps in our taproom filled with a huge variety of in-house crafted beer, in-house crafted spirits and cocktails, and a variety of wines. The most common thing our customers tell us is, ‚ÄúYou have something for everyone.‚Äù That‚Äôs because we don‚Äôt have 17 IPA‚Äôs on tap. We usually have 3-5 IPA‚Äôs along with a few sours, belgians, germans, lagers, pilsners, seltzer waters, etc. No matter your taste for beer, wine or moonshine, we have something you‚Äôll dig. Miner‚Äôs Light ( Lager - American Light ) Our interpretation of a light lager. One that actually has color and doesn‚Äôt taste like beer flavored water. Light bodied and crisp, this is sure to please those enthusiastic Coors, Bud and Miller drinkers and introduce them to what beer is supposed to taste like. Even the most ardent craft beer lovers will appreciate this light lager as it‚Äôs the style of beer brewed long before the bland, boring beers took over the world. ABV: 5.1% IBU: Cackler IPA ( IPA - American ) Medium-light in body with crisp, clean upfront bitterness. You‚Äôll want to take time to savor the strong tropical and citrus notes that are prevalent in this all-american IPA. Fun fact: A ‚ÄúCackler‚Äù is what they called a miner who let others do the heavy work. Sort of like Derek Zoolander (Click for video) . ABV: 7% IBU: 60 Hops: Magnum, Cascade, Centennial, Chinook Blackstrap Con Leche ( Stout - Milk / Sweet ) This coffee milk stout is smooth and silky with roasted coffee tones and a creamy finish. So easy drinking, yet totally anomalous. Fun fact: Black strap is what miners called coffee. It‚Äôs also what they called the oil that went into their oil lamps in the early 1900‚Äôs. Which makes us think a lot of miners drank really bad coffee. Oh and ‚Äúcon leche‚Äù is spanish for ‚Äúwith milk‚Äù. This beer has nothing to do with Spanish culture but we couldn‚Äôt think of anything better to use. ‚ÄúWith Milk‚Äù doesn‚Äôt look or sound cool at all. ‚ÄúCon Leche‚Äù looks and sound really cool. Go on‚Ä¶ Say it‚Ä¶ ‚Äúcon leche‚Äù. Now say it with a Spanish accent. You feel cool, right? ABV: 6.2% IBU: 30 Other: Lactose SoDo Blondin ( RPB House Blonde ) Our RPB house blonde that‚Äôs easy drinking with a light, crisp finish. Fun fact: Blondin‚Äôs are aerial ropeways used in open pits in slate quarries to transport wagon loads of rock between locations. ABV: 6% IBU: 18 Malts: 2-row, White Wheat, Golden Naked Oats, Honey Malt Hops: Magnum, Cascade Rye Hard ( Rye Saison ) Yippee-ki-yay, saison lovers. This traditional farmhouse ale sneaks in a hint of spice from the rye malt and a dry, effervescent finish that sneaks up like John McClane in an air duct. ABV: IBU: P.B.R. (Pat‚Äôs Big Relocation) ( Pale Ale ) Crisp and easy drinking American Light Lager. ABV: IBU: Hop Rescue 5 ( ipa ) Made with Citra, Mandarina Bavaria, and HBC 472. Big citrus and tropical fruit up front, crisp malt backbone, and a clean, bitter finish. ABV: 6.3% IBU: 87 No One Will Notice ( IPA - New England ) A cashmere hopped, juicy NEIPA with loads of tropical fruit flavors. ABV: 6% IBU: 29 Motorboatin‚Äô ( Florida Agave Lager ) Brewed with 55 pounds of agave, this crisp, refreshing Mexican lager showcases a perfect balance of agave‚Äôs natural sweetness and a clean, smooth finish. Brewed in collaboration with one of our amazing regulars, Tim. ABV: IBU: Stupider ( West Coast IPA ) A heavily hopped but perfectly balanced West Coast IPA. Clocking in at over 100 IBUs, this double dry-hopped beer‚Äôs citrus and tropical notes shine through, thanks to pounds and pounds of Simcoe and Centennial hops. Columbus Hops adds just a hint of spice on the back end, and the dry finish will make you want another sip immediately. ABV: IBU: Boonedoggle ( Kentucky Common ) The latest in our Pre-Prohibition series, this award winning recipe delivers a light-flavored, malt-accented beer with a slightly dry finish.¬† It may seem sessionable, but at 5.7% ABV, take your time and enjoy this one.¬† Notes of caramel and toffee with low floral hop flavor. ABV: 5.7% IBU: Mustache Ride ( Red Ale - American Amber / Red ) Mustache Ride was originally brewed and developed with the help of the Firefighters from Engine #5 . üöí It‚Äôs a super malty red ale that is perfect no matter what season it is‚Ä¶ and mustache rides. ABV: IBU: Whale Oil Beef Hooked ( Stout - Irish Dry ) This dark and delicious Irish stout is a St. Patrick‚Äôs Day must-try. With a smooth and creamy texture and hints of roasted malt, it‚Äôs the perfect way to celebrate the holiday in true Irish fashion. Cheers to the luck of the Irish! ABV: 5% IBU: Never Go Full Tropic ( Tropical Wheat Ale ) A tropical bouquet of mango, papaya, and pineapple that work seamlessly together to deliver a fruit boost to this huell melon hopped wheat with a sharp finish that doesn‚Äôt lay too heavy on the palate. ABV: 5.5% IBU: Huell Hefener ( Hefeweizen ) Banana forward hefeweizen with subtle notes of melon from the Huell Melon hops. If you like hefes or wheat beer, this is for you! ABV: 5.2% IBU: Squeeze The Day ( Key Lime Kolsh ) Kolsch aged with key lime puree and tons of vanilla beans for a tart and sweet flavor. ABV: 6% IBU: Illiana ( belgian golden strong ) Illiana is a Belgian Strong Golden Ale that is deceivingly delicious. At an undetectable 8.5%, you‚Äôll get traditional golden strong flavors like candy, bubble gum, spicy and fruity. Be careful with one. It‚Äôs so smooth you‚Äôll need to enjoy it responsibly. Fun fact: Illiana is named after the street we‚Äôre located on. ABV: IBU: Yankee Savage ‚Äì New England IPA ( IPA - New England ) Yankee Savage is our original New England IPA and what we judge all of our other NEIPAs by. We‚Äôve tweaked the recipe to give it better balance, more mouthfeel, and softer bitterness. Brewed and dry-hopped with Citra, Azacca and Motueka hops for a citrusy, hoppy and smooth NEIPA. It is back on tap, grab a pint in the taproom or take some to-go. ABV: 6.5% IBU: 34 Petal to the Mule A refreshing twist on the classic mule, this cocktail blends floral hibiscus with the zing of ginger beer, bright lime juice, a touch of sweetness from simple syrup, and a smooth kick of Florida Cracker Moonshine. Lightly sweet, gently spicy, and citrus-forward with a crisp, floral finish. ABV: IBU: Paloma Possible A light, crisp, and refreshing twist on the Paloma cocktail created by bartender Brittany. Starting with our lavender gin, we top it off with club soda and Fever Tree Sparkling Grapefruit Soda. ABV: IBU: Cold Brew Coffee Old Fashioned A twist on a classic, this rich cocktail blends No Sleep ‚ÄòTil Christmas Coffee Moonshine, Paul‚Äôs Fault Cinnamon Vanilla Moonshine, demerara syrup, and orange bitters. Deep, spiced, and perfectly balanced‚Äîyour favorite Old Fashioned with a caffeinated kick. ABV: IBU: Blueblerry Mule A bold twist on a classic, this cocktail blends small-batch lemonade moonshine, handcrafted vodka, blueberry cordial, fresh lemon juice, and spicy ginger beer. Refreshing, zesty, and packed with Southern charm in every sip. ABV: IBU: Cupid‚Äôs Run A bold blend of small-batch lemonade moonshine, fresh strawberry pur√©e, tart grapefruit juice, and a kick of fresh jalape√±o. Sweet, tangy, and just the right amount of heat‚Äîthis cocktail is a true Southern sipper with a spicy twist. ABV: IBU: Gold Jacket; Green Jacket; Who Gives A Sh**! This delightful concoction combines the classic flavors of an Arnold Palmer with an extra kick of southern charm. Imagine sipping a tall glass of cool, refreshing lemonade with a healthy shot of our sweet tea moonshine while a gentle breeze rustles through the palm trees. That‚Äôs what you get with this cocktail. Named in honor of this scene here. ABV: IBU: Blueberry Lemon Thyme Gin Smash Created with in-house-crafted gin, lemon juice, blueberry juice, fragrant thyme, and a touch of simple syrup for a refreshing cocktail. ABV: IBU: Espresso Martini Freshly brewed espresso with in-house-made Florida Cracker sugarcane shine and in-house-made demerara syrup are finished with a fresh twist of lemon. ABV: IBU: Cinnamon Vanilla Old Fashioned Paul‚Äôs Fault (Cinnamon Vanilla sugarcane moonshine), orange bitters, simple syrup, wild italian amarena cherry and orange peel. ABV: IBU: Apple Pie This low-and-slow simmered recipe featuring flavors and aromas of freshly baked apple pie has people raving at the brewery. Created with a unique blend of apple cider, apple juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, clove, allspice, and orange peel, it will surely make you feel like sweater weather is right around the corner. ABV: IBU: Coconut Lavender Moonshine Lemonade This enticing cocktail combines the exotic essence of coconut puree, the floral charm of lavender syrup, the nostalgic sweetness of old-fashioned lemonade, and a healthy pour of our Florida Cracker Sugar Cane Moonshine. It‚Äôs like sipping sunshine from a mason jar, where palm trees sway and laughter fills the air. ABV: IBU: Toes In The Sand A tantalizing twist on the classic Pina Colada that will transport you straight to the shores of paradise. Close your eyes and imagine the feeling of warm sand between your toes as you sip on this sun-kissed delight. Toes In The Sand combines the velvety smoothness of coconut cream, the tropical sweetness of ripe pineapple, and the spirited kick of Florida Cracker Sugarcane Moonshine. It‚Äôs like capturing the essence of a sunny beach day in a single glass. As you take your first sip, the creamy coconut cream gently caresses your palate, creating a velvety oasis of flavor. The tropical notes of pineapple burst forth, transporting you to a lush island where the sun shines endlessly. But adding cane sugar moonshine truly sets this drink apart. ABV: IBU: Antonico ( Prosecco ) Traditional sparkling wine with ripe green fruit and citrus notes is perfect for toasting any occasion. ABV: 11% IBU: 83 ( Rose ) This salmon-colored wine is marked by a ripe peach taste. Elegant in mouth with volume at the final. ABV: 12.5% IBU: Bel Vento ( Pinot Grigio ) White wine opens with a nose of Citrus and Floral. Dry with light Citrus and bright Acidity. Flavors of Lemon, Lime, Melon with a mineral finish. ABV: 12% IBU: Seal Rock ( Chardonnay ) Aromas and flavors of caramel apple and melon, with a light buttery finish. ABV: 13% IBU: Hooks Bay ( Sauvignon Blanc ) Pale straw color with a juicy mid-palate. Delicious tropical, bright melon and citrus notes combine with a lovely fresh, mouth-watering acidity. ABV: 13% IBU: Fritz de Katz ( Riesling ) Clear white plum color. Medium-bodied, peach, ripe apple, and mint. Really good bottle for the money. Less earthy, bigger fruit. ABV: 8.5% IBU: Decordi ( Sangue di Giuda (Sweet Red) ) Red semi sweet sparkling wine, coming from the most renowned micro zones of the Oltrepo Pavese area and obtained from Barbera, Croatina, and Uva rara grapes. The nose reminds of crushed berries, dark plums and black cherry. It has a very alluring fruity smell to it. In the mouth, the wine is slightly fizzy and just a touch sweet. Ideal with all desserts and an excellent base for fruit Sangria. ABV: 6.5% IBU: Rowdy Bush ( Petite Syrah ) Light violet in color. Well balanced with totes of plum, oak, and a hint of licorice. ABV: 14.3% IBU: Quantum Leap ( Cabernet ) Aromas of blueberry, leather and dark chocolate. While on the palate offers flavors of raspberry and blueberry complemented with notes of cassis and chocolate for a smooth finish. ABV: 14.6% IBU: Scarlet of Paris ( Pinot Noir ) Cherry and Strawberry on the nose of this Red wine from France. It is dry with soft tannins and light Vanilla spice. Flavors of Cherry, Strawberry, Baking Spice, Oak and Vanilla. View All Articles Life In Orlando Theme Parks Real Estate About Us Our Story Careers Menu Close Rockpit Brewing Brings Small Batch Beers to the Sodo District By Cassady Quintana Tucked behind a long-standing staple Cecil‚Äôs BBQ, Rockpit Brewing opened its doors in 2019 by co-founders Chris Rock and Sean Burke and quickly became a neighborhood favorite, solidifying its reputation as a top-notch brewer in the community and city. The coal-country themed brewery features a family and pet-friendly taproom and weekly events for everyone to enjoy. Inside Rockpit Brewing The moment you step inside, you're transported to the Kentucky coal-mining era with a warm interior, adorned with wooden accents and communal seating. Whether you're catching up with friends or enjoying some solo time, the relaxed atmosphere at Rockpit Brewing makes it the perfect place to unwind. A fireplace surrounded by couches offers a comfortable spot for friends and family to relax whereas the bar invites patrons to chat with the friendly and knowledgeable staff. The beertenders are ready to make recommendations and guide you through finding your perfect brew. Snacks and Sips Whether you're a seasoned beer aficionado or a casual sipper, Rockpit Brewing invites customers to explore a diverse array of crafted flavors from their ever-changing line-up of small batch beers and cocktails. Each rotation includes 3-5 IPA‚Äôs alongside sours, belgians, germans, lagers, pilsners, seltzer waters, and more! Beyond the beer diversity, Rockpit prides themselves in having options for everyone. The taproom is filled with 20 taps ranging from house crafted beer, hard seltzers, ciders, moonshine, and cocktails. Patrons at Rockpit Brewery also enjoy a tasteful perk ‚Äì the ability to order off an exclusive menu from Cecil's, with the convenience of having the Texas style BBQ dishes delivered right to their table. This collaborative dining experience allows for a more family-friendly atmosphere. What We Ordered: Espresso Martini $9 Blackberry Gin Mule $8 5oz Flight $12 [ Cackler IPA (IPA - American), Sodo Blondin (RPB House Blonde), Acai‚Äônt It (Acai Bowl Sour), & Miner‚Äôs Light (Lager - American Light)] Loaded Tots From Cecil‚Äôs $8.40 The Espresso Martini, a true delight for coffee lovers, delivered a bold and energizing kick with a perfect blend of rich espresso and premium spirits. For those seeking a fruity twist, we recommend the Blackberry Gin Mule - a balance between fresh blackberries, crispness of gin and a subtle follow up of ginger beer ‚Äì a refreshing concoction that satisfies. Of course, the stars of the show remain the variety of small-batch beers. From hop-forward ales to robust stouts, Rockpit Brewing's beer selection is a wonderful display of the artistry of brewing. Events Bring some weekly excitement to your days with different events hosted at Rockpit. Happy Hour: Every Monday - Friday from 4-7 PM Trivia: Every Tuesday from 7:30-9:30 PM Game Night: Every Wednesday from 7:30-9:30 PM Teacher Appreciation Happy Hour: Every Friday from 3-7 PM Morning Yoga & Beer: Every Saturday from 10-11 AM Concerts Football Watch Parties Markets Rockpit Brewing isn't just a brewery; it's a week-long event of activities, fun, and fantastic craft brews. Come for the beer, stay for the fun ‚Äì there's something for everyone at Rockpit! Overall Let Rockpit Brewing be your go-to spot for a casual and inviting experience in the heart of Orlando, where you can choose from a variety of drinks for a fun night out. Cheers to good times, great company, and the craft of brewing! SoDo District Orlando's vibrant SoDo district (short for "South of Downtown"), pulsates with local energy and character. Best known for its surrounding historic neighborhoods and one of Orlando‚Äôs most established hospitals, Orlando Health, this neighborhood and its residents continue to revitalize Orange Avenue and Michigan Street. Alongside mom-and-pop restaurants and local shops, large retail chains have also invested in the area offering diverse options to the community. The SoDo district caters to all ages and stages of life by offering a wide range of housing options from apartments to single-family homes. If you‚Äôre interested in finding a home in the area, our team would be happy to help! The Orlando Real is sponsored by The Pozek Group. If you‚Äôre thinking of buying or selling a home in Orlando, reach out and we would love to help! We‚Äôve been falsely accused. | Rockpit Brewing & Distilling Link to Instagram Link to Facebook Home About Store Our Drinks Spirits Food Location Events Live Music Get Free Drink Menu Menu We‚Äôve been falsely accused. The following is an email I wrote last Monday (October 14th, 2020) as part of the daily emails I send out. After being asked about this issue again, I decided to post the email here so you‚Äôre clued in on the situation. And if you don‚Äôt receive my emails, go here to sign up . You‚Äôll be the first to know about all things RockPit, including all the insanely funny things that happen to us. üôÇ ‚Äî‚Äì I‚Äôm not too fond of politics and I hate that I have to write this in the first place. Either way, politics have been intertwined into our business in the weirdest way possible and I need to clear something up. About a month ago, I received a message on Instagram. Essentially it said, ‚ÄúWe were going to come into RockPit, but we saw a political sign on your building and decided to leave.‚Äù I happened to be at the brewery at the time and went outside to investigate. I looked at our building, and I didn‚Äôt see what they were talking about. I went out to the road, thinking maybe someone stuck a sign in the front parking lot. Nothing. But then, I looked at the building next to the RockPit building, and I spotted it. I was like‚Ä¶ For those that don‚Äôt know, there are two buildings on our property. RockPit occupies the one on the left. Orlando Homebrew Supplies occupies the bottom floor of the one on the right , and we use the warehouse (the big garage door) for storage. But what most people don‚Äôt know is there is an apartment upstairs above OHBS. In fact, this is probably you right now‚Ä¶ That¬†apartment is occupied by an employee of the person that owns both of the buildings. They have been living in that apartment before we signed our lease back in 2018. And yes, the occupant of the apartment has a political sign of a presidential candidate in his window. I could see how people would confuse that window for one in our building and assume it was our sign. After all, it does look like it‚Äôs all one building. To be perfectly clear, I don‚Äôt care about the sign. I don‚Äôt get offended by the sight of a sign and assumed others wouldn‚Äôt either so I haven‚Äôt addressed the issue on a mass scale. And to be fair, most of our customers couldn‚Äôt care less. But with multiple people letting me know they and their friends won‚Äôt come to RockPit because they thought we had a political sign in our window, I felt like I had to clear this up. If you think I‚Äôm writing this to distance ourselves from our neighbor, you‚Äôd be wrong. I couldn‚Äôt care less what political sign they have in their window. Trump, Biden, Asteroid 2020, whatever. I‚Äôm writing this for two reasons. 1) If you aren‚Äôt coming to RockPit because you assumed the sign was ours, now you know why it‚Äôs there. And to quote G.I. Joe: Knowing is half the battle. Side note: I‚Äôm so happy I finally got to use that GIF. 2) As usual, I like to give you insight into the absurdity business owners have to deal with. Especially in the current political climate. It‚Äôs never boring, that‚Äôs for sure. Just another day in paradise. Seriously though. I love this stuff. Running a business without problems would probably be boring. Glad I don‚Äôt have to do it. Now if you‚Äôre wondering why I keep highlighting the word ‚Äúassumed‚Äù, there‚Äôs a good reason for it. I want you to stop doing something. If you stop doing this, you‚Äôll¬†immediately improve all areas of your life. Your work life will be less frustrating, your relationships will improve and you‚Äôll be in a better mood all the time. You ready for it? Here it is: stop making assumptions. Assumptions are the root of so many of your frustrations and create unnecessary problems in your life. If you ever muttered the statement ‚ÄúI just assumed‚Ä¶‚Äù and discovered you were wrong, you know what I‚Äôm talking about. Unclear about something? Ask questions. The truth, less frustration, and more happiness are on the other side of questions. Falsehoods, stress, and sadness are on the other side of assumptions. I mean, think about how sad it was for those who made the assumption that the political sign was ours and have missed out on some of the best beer and atmosphere in Orlando because of it. Even sadder is if they‚Äôre still unaware, they‚Äôre going to miss out on Buried Sunshine (our fastest selling New England IPA) and our new Rock Hard Water with Pineapple and Coconut this week. It breaks my heart to think about them missing out on those releases. I‚Äôm stoked you won‚Äôt have to suffer that fate. Cheers and I‚Äôll see you at RockPit this week, Chris So there you go. I hope that by posting that here, it will clear up the confusion. And again, if you don‚Äôt receive my emails, go here to sign up and add a little bit of spice to your day. My name is Chris Rock. I‚Äôm one of the co-founders of RockPit brewing. Every week, I‚Äôll send you an email that you‚Äôll actually look forward to. Why? Because I don‚Äôt send you the typical ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs what happening at RockPit this week‚Äù. I take the time to truly connect you to RockPit brewing on a personal level. No. Our events are ticketed per person, not per tree, so everyone attending must have a ticket. This is because space is limited in our venues and we need to be able to sell tickets for every seat we have available. If someone takes a seat in our space without having purchased a ticket, that means someone who purchased a ticket may not have a seat. Thank you for understanding. Are Bonsai Bar workshops 21+? Maybe! We want everyone of all ages to get to enjoy the fun of tiny trees. Luckily most of our venues are family friendly and allow those that are underage to enter with a parent/guardian. Please see the " UNDER¬†21 POLICY " listed above or contact the venue directly. Are drink tickets included in the price of a ticket? No. When should I arrive to the event? Please arrive 15 minutes before the scheduled event to get checked in and grab yourself a drink. Workshops start promptly as scheduled! Is there a waitlist if this workshop is sold out? We do not currently have a waitlist. Tickets are first come, first serve. What's included with a ticket? You get to keep: A tree you pick A ceramic pot you pick to replant your tree 2-hours of of bonsai wisdom We have for you to borrow: A bin to hold it all in Sheers to trim Chop stick Wire for sculpting Soil for repotting What is Bonsai Bar's Cancelation/Refund Policy? RESCHEDULING, CANCELING OR TRANSFERRING YOUR TICKETS PLEASE UNDERSTAND OUR POLICIES BEFORE YOU PURCHASE TICKETS. We do not offer refunds unless a particular class does not reach minimum numbers or, for some unforeseen reason, must be canceled or rescheduled by Bonsai Bar. In this case, you will offered a full refund. You will first be offered the option to choose a future class to attend.‚Äã If you cannot attend class, you must contact us BEFORE the class, and we will reschedule you for a future class. You must email us¬†before 10 AM¬†on the day of your scheduled class. You may rebook your class for an upcoming class at any brewery location we offer. Please get in touch with Bonsai Bar, not the host brewery. Happy Bonsai Customers ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ We had an amazing time and now my husband is bonsai obsessed! IT‚ÄôS HERE FOR HISTORICAL CONTEXT. DOGS ARE WELCOME. If you bring your dog with you to RockPit or enjoy petting the pups that come in, I have some bad news. You see‚Ä¶The other night a couple begrudgingly walked into the brewery. They sat at the end of the bar next to the brewery. From the start, they were less than cordial.¬†My daughter, who is super sweet and non-confrontational, immediately picked up on some ‚Äúwe hate everything, including this place‚Äù vibes from the couple. She tried her best to be kind to them, but they weren‚Äôt having any of it. A smile never adorned their faces. There were several dogs in the brewery as usual. Sean just adopted a little dog that his wife and kids were playing with at the table behind the unhappy couple. At some point during their agonizing 32-minute visit, one of Sean‚Äôs kids passed the 2-pound dog across the table to Sean‚Äôs wife. This set them off. They immediately pulled out their phones and started snapping pictures of Sean‚Äôs wife holding the dog in her arms. As if that wasn‚Äôt creepy enough the first few times, they kept at it for several minutes. I suppose they couldn‚Äôt get enough of the cute dog. That, or they‚Äôre just total creepers. I‚Äôm leaning towards the latter. Upon receiving their check, they asked to speak to the manager. It just so happens that it was Sean that evening. The pup‚Äôs dad they were creeping on. They proceeded to tell Sean that having dogs at an establishment was illegal. Further, they said they were locals, and they would never return because we allowed dogs at the brewery. They also said they‚Äôd be reporting us to the health department. Sean simply replied, ‚ÄúThank you for coming in. Have a good evening.‚Äù After the miserable couple scurried out of the door, the people around them asked Sean, ‚ÄúWhat the hell was wrong with those people?‚Äù and told him, ‚ÄúYou handled that WAY better than I would have.‚Äù When Sean told me about the situation, I immediately went to look at Yelp and Google for the bad review. I was expecting the 1-star review to hit both sites quickly. But the review never came. Fast forward to last week. We get a visit from the health department. As usual, there were several dogs at the brewery. The person from the health department demanded that we tell everyone who had dogs with them to leave. Sean said: The health inspector said, ‚ÄúI have to tell you, it‚Äôs up to you how you handle it.‚Äù To which Sean replied, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we have attorneys.‚Äù As far as the health department is concerned, dogs aren‚Äôt allowed ANYWHERE on the property of a brewery. This includes the outside porches. I know other brewery owners and managers read this email. So be prepared for a visit soon. Especially if the creepers visit your brewery. To be TOTALLY fair to the health inspector, they were VERY cordial and said they were just doing their job. And I 100% agree with that. They have a boss to answer to and the health inspector stuck around for a while to chat with us. So I DO NOT BLAME them at all. I do blame the miserable couple who had nothing better to do with their time than file complaints about something that nearly every single brewery in Orlando supports . Even if it isn‚Äôt technically ‚Äúallowed‚Äù, it‚Äôs one of those things that aren‚Äôt typically enforced. Like going 5 miles over the speed limit. Technically illegal, yet usually never enforced. So we‚Äôre going to rekindle the fight on this. More specifically, Sean is leading this fight. Beyond getting our brewery doors opened, I‚Äôve never seen him more obsessed with anything more than defeating this and allowing dogs at our brewery again. Dog and breweries go together like hops and IPAs and we intend on fighting this legally. That doesn‚Äôt mean we are going to go at it alone. In fact, several other breweries have been leading an effort to get this changed for a few years now. In even sadder news, our government ‚Äúleaders‚Äù here in Florida had a chance to change this law and it died in the Florida senate. http://www.flsenate.gov/Session/Bill/2019/1219/?Tab=BillHistory So much for the representation of the small business. Especially when each of the senators on that committee has many small craft breweries in their districts. In the meantime, the pups have to stay home until we get this resolved. We are absolutely heartbroken over telling you this. Especially when you consider our first paying customer EVER at RockPit had his dog with him. Ben and Apollo enjoying the first paid beer at RockPit We intend on getting this resolved quickly. There are several avenues we can take and we‚Äôre going to pursue each one until we find that one that works best for you. Expect an update soon on this as we fight through this over the next few weeks. The good news is whatever we do to ultimately win this fight, we can pass that knowledge on to other breweries so they can follow in our footsteps until our government leaders get off their asses and get the law changed.
